summary: This is a transcript of a sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with the Warden of FCI Fort Dix, who was previously the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York at the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding Epstein's incarceration, the July 23, 2019 incident, the failure to assign him a cellmate after his cellmate was transferred, and the subsequent failures in rounds, counts, and camera systems that contributed to the environment leading to his suicide on August 10, 2019.

events.title: First Incident with Tartaglione
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein found in fetal position in his cell with a red neck and possible string around neck. Inconclusive whether it was a suicide attempt or an altercation with cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Epstein placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein was cleared by psychology and taken off psychological observation/suicide watch. An email was sent stating he needed to be housed with an appropriate cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Reyes Transferred
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of MCC (With All Belongings - WAB), leaving Epstein without a cellmate. SHU OIC Angel Quinones claims he informed oncoming staff, but the information was not acted upon.

events.title: Epstein's Unmonitored Phone Call
events.description: Epstein was given an unmonitored social phone call by unit manager T. J. Grooms on a legal line. He claimed to call his mother (who was deceased), a man answered, and the call was not properly monitored.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., Correctional Officer Michael Noel found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell with a torn bedsheet around his neck. CPR was initiated, but he showed no signs of life and was later pronounced dead at the hospital.

events.title: Warden Removed from MCC
events.description: The Warden was told to report to the regional office and was removed from his position at MCC, replaced by another warden.

events.title: OIG Sworn Interview
events.description: The DOJ OIG conducts a lengthy sworn interview with the former MCC Warden as part of its investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) / Nine South, MCC
515 Madison Avenue, 31st floor, New York, NY (location of interview)
keyFacts: The Warden confirmed that inmate Efrain Reyes, Epstein's cellmate, was transferred out of MCC (With All Belongings) on August 9, 2019, and that Epstein was left without a cellmate for approximately 24 hours, a critical failure.

The Warden stated that multiple staff failures occurred: SHU officers did not conduct proper 30-minute rounds or accurate counts on August 9-10, and lieutenants failed to pass critical information up the chain of command about the need for a new cellmate.

The Warden acknowledged that the camera system in the SHU was antiquated, had known failures, and was not recording at the time of Epstein's death, due to ongoing delays in installing a new system primarily due to manpower and funding issues.
The Warden revealed that he was removed from his position at MCC on August 12, 2019, and reassigned to the regional office, though he was not formally disciplined and maintained his SES rank.

The OIG investigation revealed significant paperwork failures: count slips were inaccurate and pre-filled, round sheets were not properly completed, and Epstein's SHU file and cell assignment in the BOP database were incorrect.
